bow: anyone else have hard time with mom groups first like to say that ve been suffering from postpartum depression and having an increasingly difficult time getting out and talking to anyone ve just started counseling finally ve been having really really hard time joining groups online facebook groups seem okay at first but then have to leave because ca handle the judgement for whatever doing had to leave postpartum mental health support group on facebook because one admin was so annoying the only way to get her to leave me alone was to leave it sucks because everyone else was so supportive but it not just facebook groups it local groups too most of them seem really slow if not dead they only meet like once month or they meet far away lot of them center around exercise that ca do because reasons or crunchy stuff tried all of it and absolutely none of it worked out other than breastfeeding or they re religious and an atheist there few groups for military women spouses but not military and nobody in my family currently is it hard to get out and meet people so hard that ve become really jaded by the find mom friends advice ve gotten like now convinced it the worst advice anyone could get and it definitely the worst advice ve gotten the online groups are for the most part way better than anyone in real life has anyone else had this experience or is my ppd making me crazy and triggering my social anxiety feel exactly the same way it not just you used to be on breastfeeding groups on facebook left for different reasons but still never posted anything but liked reading their stuff so all for breastfeeding and support everything they say there but they treat it like it such big deal you ca even say oh gave my baby pacifier without getting kicked out they are totally obsessed honestly felt like cult or something lol ve had really good luck rarely seek personal advice or support so seldom in position to be directly judged if someone happens to express judgmental opinions about something do it does phase me maybe this is an age thing dunno in religious group despite being agnostic and love it it honestly one of my favorite groups have mom friends who are crunchy and others who are not some groups are inactive but suppose that also on me for being one of many members that does create events depends on where naps fall ll sometimes drive 30 minutes to meetup best ideas go to events already organized by the community story times at book stores and libraries free museum days museum day live coming up this weekend if you re in the us reduced admission days at gardens or zoos and keep an eye on the big local mom groups for people announcing new meetup oriented groups ca give advice about finding friend or mom friends because have had the same issue but have you had your thyroid tested not just normal tsh but whole thyroid panel low thyroid is linked to ppd atheist but find the church groups very cheap and well put together ca you just ignore any religious stuff they do think it important to drag yourself out of the house even if you do participate much how old is your kid found that the make mom friends advice did need to be super structured thing once the baby was old enough to be outside around other kids without me worrying about her getting sick we just go out to places and there would be other moms out doing the same parent and me story time at the library chilling on blanket at park even just meandering through target mid day were all big winners for me it helps lot if you re comfortable striking up conversations with other parents of course but almost everyone ve talked to has been friendly and happy to chat your kid is so cute how old are they how he she sleeping these days what do you like to get out and do during the day all seem to be small talk folks are very comfortable with and if you start regularly going places you ll start recognizing folks etc good luck going to piggy back on this ve also found mom friends at parks and at toddler centric places my current favorite is the library for baby toddler reading time and the gym that is for kids under the age of yes those kid gym places are great too we ve only been sporadically since the playtime for my daughter age group always seems to line up with her naptime do seem to do real well in mom groups ve had far more success making friends random places neighbors moms meet when out with the kids at the playground swimming pool etc if you meet someone you would like to see again suggest extanging numbers and setting up playdate there are lots of lonely moms or mom who would like to make more friends for both them and their kids that stinks romp and roll near us has lot of great options we feel pretty lucky do zero facebook groups they get so snarky and judgmental so fast and it just not worth it to me my couple of reddit subs have been lovely so far but that still all online do have couple of friends with kids but we did become friends as moms so that different too they ve found their best successes from groups that are just mom groups but are things like regular play groups storytimes that kind of thing in community centres and libraries especially if it sign up kind of thing it tends to be the same kids and parents most of the time so they re able to connect in that setting and sometimes things grow out of that but yeah it definitely tough hate my local mom group they re religious affiliated but that is what bothered me it was the stepford wives like cult in that they all dressed and acted alike jeans and converse kind of mom and really stood out amongst their leggings and matching infinity scarves they were also too fake nice and really invaded my personal space ve made three other mom friends and met them all at my local library during reading time we ve met several times for play dates and we get along well neither of us fit with the organized mom group and work better in smaller one on one setting ve tried probably 30 different mom groups on facebook end up leaving all of them after couple of weeks because of everything you said or what they post about isn what joined for joined one group my sister is in that specifically for atheist parents and was so excited to find my people and it not at all what it was when my sister had kid my kid age years ago it not anything about being atheist all they all post about is social and political issues that totally fine and agree with almost everything they post about but didn join that group to talk about ableism and racism and feminist issues joined groups related to those issues for those issues joined this one to talk about being judged for being an atheist living in the bible belt and having child while not being married ditto joined church group these are my ladies now 95 awesome ca believe you actually believe in demons will happily sit through prayers and reflect on my life when speaker from the church delivers lesson appreciate the time for quiet reflection and childcare in my experience if it mothers group and not bible study they re more likely to talk about cracked nipples and diaper explosions than what the prophets said been considering downloading peanut myself but have hard time breaking the ice too and was afraid of how awkward it would end up being got so annoyed with mom groups that just started hosting my own get together twice month work at home so it all can commit to right now joined few mom fb group and post the event in them sometimes get good group of people to show sometimes no one shows and that fine too enjoy alone time and it forces me to go outside it not just you mom groups can me really really hard for lots of reasons just want to tell you that things will get much easier for you in the coming years take it one day at time try to get out as much as you can by walking your baby going to the library and doing things that fuel your own self your baby will be content to just be with you now that my child is in school find it easier to talk to other parents that have children in my kids class it not all about being mom and it just casual and real those first few years post partum can just be really hard physically but emotionally too understand it can get lonely hugs to you you ll get through this lt this is kind of an issue with the religious mom groups here how stepford wives they are in really conservative rural area too so it not like have the option of just finding another church or trying to ignore the fact that also stick out like sore thumb among these types do you think that maybe you would be better off searching for groups that are specifically not mom related do you have any hobbies that you are currently into or want to get into obviously there is the issue of what to do with your baby during the group meeting that is mom related but for that maybe you could try mom day out type program or just looking for babysitter or looking for groups that meet during times when your so is available to parent sometimes when you re dealing with ppd its better to be around people who can help you talk about things that are directly mom and kid related to help you regain your identity as person not just mom back sometimes the mom groups are actually worse because its just spending more time dwelling on momming yes our local libraries even have mommy amp me yoga classes where ve met so many cool moms op know you said exercise is possibility for you but with baby yoga you re really just holding them in your lap and stretching their little bodies bit or sometimes there little music classes where you just sit in circle and sing and clap and such whatever you re into see if there mommy and me version around was completely lost until kiddo started school then suddenly found really sold group of mum friends without really trying deliberate look also have created tiny human never worked for me recently made facebook post complaining about there not being any mom groups for working moms like myself my friends made really good suggestion which was to start my own mom group plan to start one soon ve been feeling this way for the past few days and am trying to find new not mom groups that are nearby quite few of the ones ve seen are still really kid friendly not so sure about toddler friendly but ve seen very young children in some of the pics that are publicly available and yes you re very right about finding people who can talk about things that are parent or kid related with the mom groups there was so much comparison and dwelling on momming and it honestly just made the isolation was already dealing with lot worse yup feel so out of place have fortunately been part of an amazing mom group that was spin off of the longest shortest time podcast group on facebook we are extremely strict about not judging others we have written bylaws have board and offer some of the best support have ever seen on the internet we have helped members financially and have had meet ups all across the country it is amazing unfortunately this is not common some are down right vicious groups make your own mom group admin my own and we are over 500 strong now ve found my niche and it feels wonderful if you pm me can link you if you like to join we like to keep it local but we can make an exception just keep trying being mom can be extremely isolating at times agree with the free library play groups ours has music class for babies few times month also once put my year old in preschool one day week to socialize got to meet some seemingly nice parents go to support group at milkworks it breastfeeding clinic but lots of us also use bottles they re super relaxed and non judgey if you have le leche league milkworks or pregnancy center you might find something we have good mix of atheist christian cloth regular diaper bottle breast organic mcdonald etc removed have had it tested but this is the first time ve heard about thyroid testing it just hard finding doctor who will take my insurance around here that was my experience an online breast feeding groups except had little bit worse because physically not able to produce enough milk because of hypoplasia they can be horrifically judgey and cultish go to my local library for story time it free once week and get to meet moms with babies around my son age like it because you can focus on your child but there is some time to interact and get to know the other moms let me and my hermit anxiety shell slowly come out in my time and it doesn cost me monthly due like some of the mom groups looked up bet you herd that you just did insist enough since not producing milk is sooo rare it not possible for you to have it plus bunch of what you should should do those women preach no judgment all the time but they are the first to judge if you do one little thing they do approve hope they did upset you lt removed it is hard to make new mom friends the mom groups around me get together couple of times month the mothers do not seem like my kind of people they are the type that have to do their hair and make up before the meet up group try to show off what they have am very chill person who keeps to myself for the most part hate drama and am not gossip about other moms type of person it has always been hard to find female friends always got along with guys better because they have so much less drama and are much more honest and up front wish had sahm friends but find mommit so much nicer than being around actual moms oh and the groups focused around exercise no thanks swim for exercise and it is my own personal thing and my alone time be kind to yourself my twins are almost and barely have any mom friends you re not alone reach out to any comfortable relationships you have friends family or just give yourself permission to be by yourself and with your kids for bit and the therapy should really help do be afraid of anti depressants this is real hormonal chemical imbalance and it not your fault people who are judgmental online have too much time and are looking for attention and validation big hugs from stranger on the interwebs ❤️ the only mom friends have just happened to have kids around the same time as me we were friends before kids dont think mom status is common ground enough for friendships and besides your whole day probably revolves around mom stuff friend time is for you what are you interested in just you before husband and kids go do that find yourself enjoy yourself and chat up the people around you regardless of if they are moms just make friends instead of this mom group thing that makes me roll my eyes colorado checking in same here have one mom friend who was my friend previous to us being mom all my other friends are not parents suck at meeting friends being mom should be your main identity to me that like saying oh you got dog you should find dog group and only hang out with them oh you re blonde you should join blonde hair group to discuss how you treat and maintain your hair dont think mom groups are necessary if you happen to meet another mom at some kid event or school then awesome but do focus too much on it feel you there is one mom and babies group here that used to go to with my mom sometimes when she brought my brothers but now that have my own baby to bring it full of some weird people when say weird mean my brother girlfriend joined with their kid and they re the kind of parents who honestly believe there are monkey fetuses in vaccines yeah pretty much just stuck to the reddit breastfeeding sub its much more real life without the extra side of judgement monkey fetuses lol how did miss this theory ditto and in colorado as well oh man is that the best when was in my research thing obsessively stage of realizing had hypoplasia all the websites lll is guilty of this too would emphasize that there only rare 10 chance that mother would be physically incapable of breastfeeding umm you guys do you know how many mothers there are that *shitton* of people you are totally my long lost sahm soul mate every last word you said is also me do get all dolled up to go to storytime playground etc super chill and could care less about being gossip find guy friends to be much easier to make and have membership at the ymca cause they have childcare and can swim for exercise solo live in an affluent area and so many of the mom groups nearby are snooty and just ca even with them my kid is 10 and still hate mommy groups just did get along with most moms find it is lot easier to make friends online you may want to try interest based groups where parenting is required then you can make connections on something other than having kid providing more to talk about if they happen to have kids great but do worry about that feeling the same way when mothers dismiss scientific evidence because they re scared of anything they deem unnatural and unnecessary even if evidence shows that they put their children at risk am member of the church where this group takes place but we go to playgroup called little fishes where you pay £1 week and the kids gets toast soldiers and cut up fruit and parents get hot buttered toast and tea coffee there loads of toy and then at the end we all sit in circle and sing songs no religion whatsoever 10 really does sound very rare to me my kids are similar ages and dance lot find the dance mom cliques just as hard as found new mom groups have to say looking forward to next year when my kids have decided to drop one of the classes because sick of the mom clique that associated with that class yes that pretty much my experience too do do mom groups either can handle close mom friend with kids the same age as mine and then just rely on drop in friendships moms at the park strike up convo with for day to day socialization do do mom groups got pregnant at 18 and never meshed well with the types that did mom groups we just had nothing in common they were the mom is their only identity types and was pot smoking atheist who was honestly slightly trashy still am my kid is almost now and my best friends now have year olds it fine now it gets better is it open to people in various communities have been looking for something like this and so sad the main mamas group is closed unfortunately not am sorry the main group was really good for so long this sounds so pleasant love to go just for the toast soldiers hate facebook mom groups so much judgement and anecdotal evidence instead of research based evidence when my daughter was tiny the volunteers would always hold her so could get coffee and toast it was the only day of the week got my breakfast hot and it was honestly amazing people love lll but found lot of their website so judgy it amazing how horrible we can be to each other the one was in originally was really awesome but stopped accepting members almost immediately after joined because it had gotten so large when had my baby the women in it were really awesome about urging people to take their kids to the doctor and using research based evidence instead of well my sister friend cousin grandma had issue and but then the admin opened the group back up to new members and that when all the anecdata and judgement started left when someone posted badly written news article about study from 2008 that linked pitocin to ppd the thing is pitocin is used in more difficult births so it was the pitocin that caused my depression but the fact that my induction took so long and ended in section and difficult births are factor in postpartum depression anyway but the natural birth crowd saying oh well it just something to think about would hear any of it that was the last straw for me have found good group since then facebook or otherwise yes signed up on few on facebook and pretty much only pay attention to events for kids now stick to the reddit ones for the most part what gets me about the bullying on the facebook ones is live in really small town and just amazed the these mean mom do get punched in the face like we all know where they live and what they look like as for mom friends ve made one acquaintance at playgroup that twin mom as well other mom steer clear of twin mom for some reason felt super uncomfortable with the whole mum group thing and never joined one my city has this fantastic place where you can just hang out and let the little ones play with toys and the parents mostly mums can hang and and shoot the breeze with cup of tea or coffee felt intimidated when first started going but one time couple of the volunteers there were knitting and being knitter too felt way more comfortable take my almost three year old daughter there all the time now and have made many new friends just avoid the people who are my cup of tea and chat with the like minded people perhaps finding group that meets for hobby you have might help you more than something baby focused if you do have drop in baby centre type place though give that fair crack making mom friends is so hard my two los are and years old and still struggle ve had the best successs with mom who have kids that are the same ages as my kids it only after repeated contact of activities that finally makes things click you re not the only one that struggles mom to be in colorado think very lucky to have bunch of pregnant friends from college same major even and church total in very small congregation one of those busy all the time people so planning to use playdates as an excuse to see them more often to reply directly to your comment my friend who is expecting her 4th joined mops for support but found it all really conservative religious people not anyone she hang out with if they were moms just expecting now but ve found myself burning out on pregnancy found from time to time the advice to find people you have something in common with who remind you of who you are outside of being mom seems like the best thing burned out and had to get treated for depression in college and the thing that helped was finding my self worth outside of being good student yes my local one is terrible any mention of formula gets wave of comments of formula is absolutely not necessary you re just not putting the baby on the boob enough formula is terrible do give it and people completely disregarding advice from pediatricians it crazy and god forbid anyone mention anything about solids at all if their baby is older than months yep mean they can have their own opinion send scientific articles but there no need to be rude my baby never had formula we introduced solids at months and she does eat sugar at 21 months old do go over telling this is the rule for everyone if someone asked for my opinion or help sure say something ve left crying mom groups hating mom groups and in general just thinking other stay at home moms are really not very nice people here in minnesota the crunchy cult is so bad like do mind it actually think it awesome but they treat you so badly if you do follow it or god forbid say you ca it makes me feel incredibly lonely want freaking amp group for ladies because they are sought out when women have the tuberous breast that sometimes accompany it the lack of information given to ob gyn about the breast is shocking remember reading somewhere that in
